definition: to speak in a pleasant and captivating manner (idiom)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: What has been your charge for repeating this very plausible story?
sentences.chinese: 你複述這個娓娓動聽的故事，得到了多少酬勞？

sentences.english: He is good at telling stories, and can attract the attention of all the children.
sentences.chinese: 他講起故事來娓娓動聽，吸引了所有小朋友的注意力。

sentences.english: Her performance was pleasing, though by no means capital.
sentences.chinese: 她的表演雖然說不上奇妙絕倫，也還娓娓動聽。

sentences.english: It has been said that Thoreau's style is conversational.
sentences.chinese: 有人說梭羅的文章娓娓動聽。

sentences.english: She can dish up the story in a humorous way.
sentences.chinese: 她能幽默地把這故事講得娓娓動聽。

sentences.english: The teacher dished up the story in a humorous way.
sentences.chinese: 老師以幽默風趣的語調，把故事講得娓娓動聽。

sentences.english: This story was told in a pleasant and interesting way.
sentences.chinese: 這個故事講得娓娓動聽。
